intro: Lucuma avenia, commonly known as the golden apple, is a South American plant native to the Andes mountains. It belongs to the family Sterculiaceae and is characterized by its large, yellow-orange fruit that resembles an apple. The fruit has a sweet, nutty flavor and is rich in nutrients such as vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants. The plant thrives in high-altitude regions with cool, temperate climates. Its botanical features make it a valuable crop for both culinary and medicinal uses.
